isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLES: SPICER J400-S, W460-S - ASSEMBLE - INTERMEDIATE CASE

step1.para: Install bearing cups into the idler gear. Be certain cups are pressed completely into gear or improper measurement of end play will result.
Install bearing spacer and bearings into idler gear. The end play is controlled by the bearing spacer ( Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Install Bearing Spacer and Bearings into Idler Gear

note.para: On one side of the idler gear is stamped "TO REAR." It is important that this be installed correctly, for proper gear alignment.

step1.para: Install idler gear into intermediate case. Slide gear into position ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Install Idler Gear into Intermediate Case

step1.para: Install idler shaft into idler gear and intermediate case ( Figure 69).

figure.caption: Figure 69. Install Idler Shaft into Idler Gear

step1.para: Install input gear bearing cup into intermediate case. Use of Loctite to help retain bearing cup in case is advisable.
Use a machinist's square ( Figure 70) or make an assembly fixture ( Figure 71 and Figure 72) to align the idler shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 70. Use Machinist's Square to Align Idler Shaft
Figure 71. Make Assembly Fixture to Align Idler Shaft
Figure 72. Make Assembly Fixture to Align Idler Shaft

step1.para: Mount intermediate case in a vise, clamped onto the flat sides of the idler shaft. Install a new prevailing torque nut and tighten to 500 to 600 ft-lbs. (678 to 813 Nm) ( Figure 73).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Install New Prevailing Torque Nut

step1.para: Using a dial indicator, check end play. End play should be .001 to .006 inch. If it is not to specification, change bearing spacer. Use a thinner spacer to decrease end play or a thicker spacer to increase end play ( Figure 74).

caution.para: Any preload on the idler gear bearings will cause premature bearing failure.

step1.para: Be certain old gasket material is removed from mounting surface of carrier housing and intermediate case. Place 1/8 inch bead of RTV gasket material onto carrier housing as shown in Figure 75.

figure.caption: Figure 75. Place RTV Gasket Material onto Carrier Housing

step1.para: Use a hoist and position intermediate case onto carrier assembly ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Position Intermediate Case onto Carrier Assembly

step1.para: Install intermediate case mounting bolts and tighten to 75 to 90 ft-lbs. (102 to 122 Nm).

note.para: The 5 shorter bolts must be installed from the rear of the intermediate case.

step1.para: Assemble bearing cones onto front and rear of input gear and install input gear assembly into intermediate case. Rotate to make sure it is seated properly ( Figure 77).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Install Input Gear Assembly into Intermediate Case

step1.para: Assemble shift fork onto shift collar and install into intermediate case. Be sure the boss on the shift fork is pointing up or towards the inter-axle differential before installing (as shown in Figure 78). Unit will not shift correctly if installed improperly.

figure.caption: Figure 78. Be Sure Boss on Shift Fork is Pointing Up or Toward Inter-Axle Differential

step1.para: Install shift fork shaft into intermediate case and thread into shift fork. Tighten shaft to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 52 Nm) ( Figure 79). Place spring over shaft. Compress spring and install retainer clip into groove in shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 79. Install Shift Fork Shaft into Intermediate Case
